div.div: εἶδος , εος (ϝιδ), dat. εἴδεϊ: appearance, looks, esp. of the human countenance, and mostly with a suggestion of beauty; freq. as acc. of specification with adjectives, and often coupled w. μέγεθος, φυή, δέμας. Of a dog, ταχὺς θέειν ἐπὶ εἴδεϊ τῷδε, a fast runner ‘with all that good looks,’ Od. 17.308.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
